subject: AW: [junit] JUnit is unable to find the Testclasses
msgSnippet: we just tried to put them in the directory where the Tests are located that come with the distribution of JUnit. They are displyed in the graphical test runner
messageBody:
we just tried to put them in the directory where the Tests are located that
come with the distribution of JUnit. They are displyed in the graphical test
runner but when we are trying to run them JUnit tells us that the class
definition are not found.
Michael

-----Ursprüngliche Nachricht-----
Von: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
Gesendet: Freitag, 9. März 2001 15:39
An: junit@yahoogroups.com
Betreff: Re: [junit] JUnit is unable to find the Testclasses


Sounds like a classpath problem. Make sure your test classes are in
the classpath.

Mike


--- "Nisius, Michael" <michael.nisius@...> wrote:
> Hi,
> we are doing our first steps with Junit and are trying to start tests
> from
> the command prompt using the graphical TestRunner. Junit keeps
> telling us
> that he is unable to find the test classes.
>
> Does it has anything to do with setting the classpath right, or could
> it be
> a problem with the TestClass itself. The tests that come with the
> JUnit
> distribution are found without any problems. Any suggestions?
>
> Michael
